text: RT @scottdegg: @EnvAgency @JamesBevanEA @NewsNBC this tweet pretty much sums it up... when will Red Industries mismanagement of Walleys Qua‚Ä¶

@iantokelove @midiwife @EnvAgencySE Ah yes, we know where that is. Thanks for reporting it. Come spring or summer, let‚Äôs us know when you‚Äôre passing and pop in for a tea at our moorings on the way.

@riverroding @midiwife Ah, roll on summer! We'd hoped to see a kingfisher, a splash of colour against the drab winter tones, but no luck on this trip. BTW, part of the re-enforced riverbank has collapsed in Ilford. No threat to navigation & reported to @EnvAgencySE https://t.co/fPEJNEhumD
RT @HorwichFirst: Having done more digging @TheBoltonNews @ChrisGeeLDR it appears @HorwichC DEFERRED making a decision March 2019 awaiting‚Ä¶

Having done more digging @TheBoltonNews @ChrisGeeLDR it appears @HorwichC DEFERRED making a decision March 2019 awaiting @EnvAgencyNW and @NaturalEngland comments. @boltoncouncil then never sent it back to @HorwichC. Very poor form! https://t.co/tcx2ytPa0r
@EnvAgency @JamesBevanEA @NewsNBC this tweet pretty much sums it up... when will Red Industries mismanagement of Walleys Quarry be addressed?  @StinkStopthe https://t.co/ZpBpaZ7xcS

RT @FieldStudiesC: This upcoming online event, 'Youth Voice Summit: Rethinking Water' is a fantastic opportunity for young people to engage‚Ä¶

@EnvAgencyNW Good Evening,
As victims of the devastating effects of river flooding on our family home in Nantwich for the second time in as many years (the latest being just 3 weeks ago) we would very much like to know what is being done to tackle the problem in our town? Please dm.

@Dr_H_Glanville @wildacademy @slowtheflow_UK @Ragsie123 @rggeo @EnvAgencyYNE @nationaltrust @Calderdale Gosh! It sounds like your not able to catch a break! Its sounds like really hard work right now!  Let me know if I can help in any way I am more than happy to help. Thank you! It was only possible with your support and I learnt from the best ‚ù§
@EnvAgencyNW
RT @Archivist_Liz: This is the trashtrap where the River Brent meets Welsh Harp Reservoir, a Site of Special Scientific Interest. Met a guy‚Ä¶

This is the trashtrap where the River Brent meets Welsh Harp Reservoir, a Site of Special Scientific Interest. Met a guy from @EnvAgency clearing it but it‚Äôs 1 wheelbarrow at a time so slow-going. They won‚Äôt touch beyond the trap bcus it‚Äôs not their remit. But sadly‚Ä¶
